issue.title: Update galaxy-tool-util requirement from <23 to <24

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: python
labels.description: Pull requests that update Python code

issue.body:
Updates the requirements on [galaxy-tool-util](https://github.com/galaxyproject/galaxy) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from galaxy-tool-util's releases.

v23.1.1

What's Changed

  • Version 23.1.dev by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15353
  • Towards decoupling datatypes and model by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15186
  • Fix bad auto-merge of dev. by @​jmchilton in galaxyproject/galaxy#15386
  • vueify formUpload with composition API by @​assuntad23 in galaxyproject/galaxy#15409
  • Bump ua-parser-js from 0.7.31 to 0.7.33 in /client by @​dependabot in galaxyproject/galaxy#15425
  • Outline Deployment Tests by @​jmchilton in galaxyproject/galaxy#15420
  • Drop defineEmits import from FormUpload by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15450
  • Prettier targeting refinements by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15449
  • Move database access code out of tool_util by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15467
  • Follow up to #15186 by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15388
  • Make serving address more visible in console by @​davelopez in galaxyproject/galaxy#15468
  • Merge 23.0 into dev by @​mvdbeek in galaxyproject/galaxy#15492
  • Stricter typescript config by @​ElectronicBlueberry in galaxyproject/galaxy#15311
  • Create ToolSuccess route and refactor component by @​ahmedhamidawan in galaxyproject/galaxy#15484
  • Merge 23.0 into dev by @​mvdbeek in galaxyproject/galaxy#15498
  • Use connection instead of session for ItemGrabber by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15496
  • Implement initial tool/wf test assertions module for JSON data. by @​jmchilton in galaxyproject/galaxy#15494
  • Update Python dependencies by @​galaxybot in galaxyproject/galaxy#15435
  • Merge 23.0 into dev by @​mvdbeek in galaxyproject/galaxy#15511
  • Various Tool Shed Cleanup by @​jmchilton in galaxyproject/galaxy#15247
  • xsd: add multiple to the list of attributes for all parameter types deriving from select by @​bernt-matthias in galaxyproject/galaxy#15534
  • Add basic selenium test for shared histories by @​davelopez in galaxyproject/galaxy#15538
  • Phylocanvas rebuild by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15521
  • Move TS to Alembic by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15509
  • Add new release tags to manage_toolshed_db.sh script by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15542
  • Merge 23.0 into dev by @​mvdbeek in galaxyproject/galaxy#15546
  • Use sentry-fastapi integration, expose sampling rate by @​mvdbeek in galaxyproject/galaxy#15550
  • Merge release_23.0 into dev by @​mvdbeek in galaxyproject/galaxy#15566
  • Updating build-related dependencies, static cleanup. by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15527
  • Have prettier use a cache. by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15575
  • QUnit elimination by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15452
  • Update browserslist and exclusions, linting. by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15524
  • Drop workflow exports to myexperiment.org by @​dannon in galaxyproject/galaxy#15576
  • Added title on anchor tag on keyboard Focus for W3C Accessibility Compliance by @​hujambo-dunia in galaxyproject/galaxy#15517
  • Merge 23.0 into dev by @​mvdbeek in galaxyproject/galaxy#15581
  • add missing f for f-string by @​bernt-matthias in galaxyproject/galaxy#15584
  • Fix jest tests run on CI by @​davelopez in galaxyproject/galaxy#15588
  • Handle "email_from" config option consistently, as per schema description by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15557
  • Merge 23.0 into dev by @​mvdbeek in galaxyproject/galaxy#15594
  • Bump undici from 5.14.0 to 5.19.1 in /client by @​dependabot in galaxyproject/galaxy#15609
  • Alternatively allow double quotation marks in search filters by @​guerler in galaxyproject/galaxy#15606
  • Update database_heartbeat for SA 2.0 compatibility by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15611
  • Unify url handling with filesources by @​nuwang in galaxyproject/galaxy#15497
  • Explore tool remote test data by @​davelopez in galaxyproject/galaxy#15510
  • Update supports_skip_locked, supports_returning for SA 2.0 compatibility by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15633
  • Fix call to docker_cached_container_description by @​bernt-matthias in galaxyproject/galaxy#15598
  • Wrap check_jobs_at_startup operation in a transaction (SA 2.0 compatibility) by @​jdavcs in galaxyproject/galaxy#15643
  • Changes to match latest playbook by @​nuwang in galaxyproject/galaxy#15647

... (truncated)

Commits
  • e77b17d Create version 23.1.1
  • 5aeff97 Merge branch 'release_23.0' into release_23.1
  • e88541e Start work on 23.0.7.dev0
  • bce8be2 Create version 23.0.6
  • 41e06d0 Merge pull request #16879 from davelopez/23.1_fix_delete_collection
  • 905a85c Remove unnecessary update if the element was already deleted in bulk
  • b7eea2f Fix typo
  • 672518c Unify bulk delete/purge behavior on collections
  • 4656698 Add asserts on history contents in tests
  • 74cbf83 Refactor API tests
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

pull_request.title: Turn batch system tests back on
pull_request.body:
This should fix #4648 by turning on the batch system tests again. The Mesos-specific ones are already moved elsewhere.

## Changelog Entry
To be copied to the [draft changelog](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/wiki/Draft-Changelog) by merger:

 * Batch system tests now run again

## Reviewer Checklist

<!-- To be kept in sync with docs/contributing/checklist.rst -->

 * [ ] Make sure it is coming from `issues/XXXX-fix-the-thing` in the Toil repo, or from an external repo.
    * [ ] If it is coming from an external repo, make sure to pull it in for CI with:
        ```
        contrib/admin/test-pr otheruser theirbranchname issues/XXXX-fix-the-thing
        ```
    * [ ] If there is no associated issue, [create one](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/issues/new).
* [ ] Read through the code changes. Make sure that it doesn't have:
    * [ ] Addition of trailing whitespace.
    * [ ] New variable or member names in `camelCase` that want to be in `snake_case`.
    * [ ] New functions without [type hints](https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html).
    * [ ] New functions or classes without informative docstrings.
    * [ ] Changes to semantics not reflected in the relevant docstrings.
    * [ ] New or changed command line options for Toil workflows that are not reflected in `docs/running/{cliOptions,cwl,wdl}.rst` 
    * [ ] New features without tests.
* [ ] Comment on the lines of code where problems exist with a review comment. You can shift-click the line numbers in the diff to select multiple lines.
* [ ] Finish the review with an overall description of your opinion.

## Merger Checklist

<!-- To be kept in sync with docs/contributing/checklist.rst -->

* [ ] Make sure the PR passes tests.
* [ ] Make sure the PR has been reviewed **since its last modification**. If not, review it.
* [ ] Merge with the Github "Squash and merge" feature.
    * [ ] If there are multiple authors' commits, add [Co-authored-by](https://github.blog/2018-01-29-commit-together-with-co-authors/) to give credit to all contributing authors.
* [ ] Copy its recommended changelog entry to the [Draft Changelog](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/wiki/Draft-Changelog).
* [ ] Append the issue number in parentheses to the changelog entry.

comment.body: Yeah, I can fix the tests. It looks like it might be an issue with the docker appliance.

issue.title: 3.8, 3.9, 3.11 appliance builds failing on CI
issue.body: For 3.8 and 3.9, I think the updated urllib library is causing dependency conflicts. What works for 3.9 doesn't seem to work with 3.10 and up. It also looks like the 3.11 build is trying to install mesos, which isn't supported.

issue.title: Fix configargparse parsing wrong in toil-cwl-runner
issue.body:
In toil-cwl-runner, configargparse sometimes doesn’t work due to a bug it has. We need a workaround for it.

If nargs=argparse.remainder on an argument, configargparse will not collect the right arguments, because the arguments from the config get tacked on the end of the argument list and can get eaten.



┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Story](https://ucsc-cgl.atlassian.net/browse/TOIL-1407)
┆Issue Number: TOIL-1407

issue.title: None of the batch system tests run anymore
issue.body:
The line that actually runs the batch system tests is commented out here:

https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/blob/15763af711b2b5d652c0fd9a46dad9dcb7e98feb/.gitlab-ci.yml#L195

We need to run those tests overall even if Mesos is not installed.

issue.title: Prevent simultaneous pulls of Singularity images by toil-cwl-runner: prefetch them all
issue.body:
Toil / cwltool should be updated to pull all Docker / Singularity containers by default before a pipeline starts running. 

If you are running a pipeline that launches multiple parallel scatter jobs, and the container for the jobs cannot be found locally, the results can be disastrous. 

This is an example what happened when I tried to run a CWL pipeline with Toil on our HPC (using LSF);

```
kellys5  33461  2.8  0.0 978332 57072 ?        Sl   16:18   1:36 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  33462  2.8  0.0 978332 59232 ?        Sl   16:18   1:35 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  33464  2.9  0.0 912796 58996 ?        Sl   16:18   1:40 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  33465  3.0  0.0 912796 55508 ?        Sl   16:18   1:43 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  33466  3.1  0.0 912796 53428 ?        Sl   16:18   1:47 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  33469  3.1  0.0 912796 56456 ?        Sl   16:18   1:45 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  33470  3.1  0.0 912796 54580 ?        Sl   16:18   1:44 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  33471  3.0  0.0 912796 55364 ?        Sl   16:18   1:41 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  34773  2.9  0.0 912796 57896 ?        Sl   16:19   1:36 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  35503  2.8  0.0 978332 56740 ?        Sl   16:19   1:34 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  35504  2.9  0.0 978332 55564 ?        Sl   16:19   1:37 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
kellys5  35505  2.8  0.0 912796 54004 ?        Sl   16:19   1:33 singularity pull --force --name stevekm_some-container:1.2.3.sif docker://stevekm/some-container:1.2.3
```

Dozens of jobs were launched, each one of them attempting to do a `singularity pull` for the same image at the same time. This ended up destabilizing the HPC filesystem for all users. 

Pulling Singularity containers in parallel like this is also advised against by the Singularity docs because it is highly likely to crash, leave a corrupted container, or otherwise error out;

https://sylabs.io/guides/3.6/user-guide/build_env.html#cache-folders
> Warning
> 
> If you are not certain that your $HOME or SINGULARITY_CACHEDIR filesytems support atomic rename, do not run Singularity in parallel using remote container URLs. Instead use singularity pull to create a local SIF image, and then run this SIF image in a parallel step.

An example error message I commonly saw was this;

```
FATAL:   could not open image /toil_runs/1632937855/work/cda001d6cc1d55f499cb751325575255/71fc/c89a/some_container:1.2.3.sif: failed to retrieve path for /toil_runs/1632937855/work/cda001d6cc1d55f499cb751325575255/71fc/c89a/some_container:1.2.3.sif: lstat /toil_runs/1632937855/work/cda001d6cc1d55f499cb751325575255/71fc/c89a/some_container:1.2.3.sif: no such file or directory
```

As a naive Toil user, I had no clue that such issues could arise just by running a pipeline that worked fine in other contexts. I ultimately found some resolution by manually doing `singularity pull` on all the known containers with env vars `SINGULARITY_CACHEDIR`, `SINGULARITY_TMPDIR`, `SINGULARITY_PULLDIR`, and `CWL_SINGULARITY_CACHE=SINGULARITY_PULLDIR` properly set and exported from the host environment to child LSF jobs. 

However, there appears to already be a tool developed for this specific purpose:
https://github.com/common-workflow-language/cwl-utils/#pull-the-all-referenced-software-container-images

Since this tool is already in the CWL codebase, and since the lack of this behavior can cause severe problems in running a CWL pipeline with Toil, it seems that this should just be merged into Toil itself and should become the default behavior. This will likely save users a huge amount of time and headaches and might even prevent some servers from being crashed.

┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Task](https://ucsc-cgl.atlassian.net/browse/TOIL-1042)
┆Issue Number: TOIL-1042

comment.body:
I don't think we can cache images before sending the jobs to the nodes when there isn't a shared filesystem between the nodes, so we do fundamentally have to support multiple jobs on the same node trying to pull Singularity containers at once.

I think right now we have some special handling for `SINGULARITY_CACHEDIR` in Toil. We could add some machinery to set good `SINGULARITY_TMPDIR`/`SINGULARITY_PULLDIR` values.

But I think what we might really need is machinery in `cwltool` to deal with the fact that the Singularity caching system is not concurrent, and the user of `singularity` is not allowed to make multiple calls to `singularity pull` of the same image at the same time. `cwltool` ought to support a user invoking several workflows at the same time on the same machine without having all of them try to pull the container into the same place.

@mr-c is that interlock something you want to implement on the cwltool team side, or do we need to try and contribute it?

issue.title: CWL Pipefish compatibility
issue.body:
This should fix #4633. It should allow running the workflow in https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/issues/4634#issuecomment-1769231393

## Changelog Entry
To be copied to the [draft changelog](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/wiki/Draft-Changelog) by merger:

 * CWL sub-workflows should now have their default input values applied
 * Directory objects shown to CWL containers should now always be full of files and never full of broken symlinks
 * Relative paths for `--workDir` and `--coordinationDir` should now be properly made absolute before being used by workers.

## Reviewer Checklist

<!-- To be kept in sync with docs/contributing/checklist.rst -->

 * [ ] Make sure it is coming from `issues/XXXX-fix-the-thing` in the Toil repo, or from an external repo.
    * [ ] If it is coming from an external repo, make sure to pull it in for CI with:
        ```
        contrib/admin/test-pr otheruser theirbranchname issues/XXXX-fix-the-thing
        ```
    * [ ] If there is no associated issue, [create one](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/issues/new).
* [ ] Read through the code changes. Make sure that it doesn't have:
    * [ ] Addition of trailing whitespace.
    * [ ] New variable or member names in `camelCase` that want to be in `snake_case`.
    * [ ] New functions without [type hints](https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html).
    * [ ] New functions or classes without informative docstrings.
    * [ ] Changes to semantics not reflected in the relevant docstrings.
    * [ ] New or changed command line options for Toil workflows that are not reflected in `docs/running/{cliOptions,cwl,wdl}.rst` 
    * [ ] New features without tests.
* [ ] Comment on the lines of code where problems exist with a review comment. You can shift-click the line numbers in the diff to select multiple lines.
* [ ] Finish the review with an overall description of your opinion.

## Merger Checklist

<!-- To be kept in sync with docs/contributing/checklist.rst -->

* [ ] Make sure the PR has been reviewed **since its last modification**. If not, review it.
* [ ] Merge with the Github "Squash and merge" feature.
    * [ ] If there are multiple authors' commits, add [Co-authored-by](https://github.blog/2018-01-29-commit-together-with-co-authors/) to give credit to all contributing authors.

auto_merge.commit_message:
* Add a bunch of value resolving logging

* Quiet debugging a bit

* Move default setting for workflows so it works on subworkflows

* Remember to keep making a ToilFsAccess on the leader

* Satisfy MyPy

* Stop giving CWL containers directories full of broken symlinks

* Update test to expect no symlinks

* Move CWL integration tests for bioconda/biocontainers to integration test runs

* Wrap mkdtemp to fix #4644

* Sort imports in example scripts

* Use absolute-ized paths for work and coordination directories

pull_request.title: Fix configargparse in CWL
pull_request.body:
This resolves #4615.
## Changelog Entry
To be copied to the [draft changelog](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/wiki/Draft-Changelog) by merger:

 * Fix config file support for CWL

## Reviewer Checklist

<!-- To be kept in sync with docs/contributing/checklist.rst -->

 * [ ] Make sure it is coming from `issues/XXXX-fix-the-thing` in the Toil repo, or from an external repo.
    * [ ] If it is coming from an external repo, make sure to pull it in for CI with:
        ```
        contrib/admin/test-pr otheruser theirbranchname issues/XXXX-fix-the-thing
        ```
    * [ ] If there is no associated issue, [create one](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/issues/new).
* [ ] Read through the code changes. Make sure that it doesn't have:
    * [ ] Addition of trailing whitespace.
    * [ ] New variable or member names in `camelCase` that want to be in `snake_case`.
    * [ ] New functions without [type hints](https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html).
    * [ ] New functions or classes without informative docstrings.
    * [ ] Changes to semantics not reflected in the relevant docstrings.
    * [ ] New or changed command line options for Toil workflows that are not reflected in `docs/running/{cliOptions,cwl,wdl}.rst` 
    * [ ] New features without tests.
* [ ] Comment on the lines of code where problems exist with a review comment. You can shift-click the line numbers in the diff to select multiple lines.
* [ ] Finish the review with an overall description of your opinion.

## Merger Checklist

<!-- To be kept in sync with docs/contributing/checklist.rst -->

* [ ] Make sure the PR passes tests.
* [ ] Make sure the PR has been reviewed **since its last modification**. If not, review it.
* [ ] Merge with the Github "Squash and merge" feature.
    * [ ] If there are multiple authors' commits, add [Co-authored-by](https://github.blog/2018-01-29-commit-together-with-co-authors/) to give credit to all contributing authors.
* [ ] Copy its recommended changelog entry to the [Draft Changelog](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/wiki/Draft-Changelog).
* [ ] Append the issue number in parentheses to the changelog entry.

* Remove unnecessary test

---------

review.body: This looks good to me!  Would be nice to have NFS testing in some capacity in the future, or we would have caught the need for 711 permissions on directories earlier I think.

pull_request.title: CWL Pipefish compatibility
pull_request.body:
This should fix #4633. It should allow running the workflow in https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/issues/4634#issuecomment-1769231393

## Changelog Entry
To be copied to the [draft changelog](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/wiki/Draft-Changelog) by merger:

 * CWL sub-workflows should now have their default input values applied
 * Directory objects shown to CWL containers should now always be full of files and never full of broken symlinks
 * Relative paths for `--workDir` and `--coordinationDir` should now be properly made absolute before being used by workers.

## Reviewer Checklist

<!-- To be kept in sync with docs/contributing/checklist.rst -->

 * [ ] Make sure it is coming from `issues/XXXX-fix-the-thing` in the Toil repo, or from an external repo.
    * [ ] If it is coming from an external repo, make sure to pull it in for CI with:
        ```
        contrib/admin/test-pr otheruser theirbranchname issues/XXXX-fix-the-thing
        ```
    * [ ] If there is no associated issue, [create one](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/issues/new).
* [ ] Read through the code changes. Make sure that it doesn't have:
    * [ ] Addition of trailing whitespace.
    * [ ] New variable or member names in `camelCase` that want to be in `snake_case`.
    * [ ] New functions without [type hints](https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html).
    * [ ] New functions or classes without informative docstrings.
    * [ ] Changes to semantics not reflected in the relevant docstrings.
    * [ ] New or changed command line options for Toil workflows that are not reflected in `docs/running/{cliOptions,cwl,wdl}.rst` 
    * [ ] New features without tests.
* [ ] Comment on the lines of code where problems exist with a review comment. You can shift-click the line numbers in the diff to select multiple lines.
* [ ] Finish the review with an overall description of your opinion.

## Merger Checklist

<!-- To be kept in sync with docs/contributing/checklist.rst -->

* [ ] Make sure the PR passes tests.
* [ ] Make sure the PR has been reviewed **since its last modification**. If not, review it.
* [ ] Merge with the Github "Squash and merge" feature.
    * [ ] If there are multiple authors' commits, add [Co-authored-by](https://github.blog/2018-01-29-commit-together-with-co-authors/) to give credit to all contributing authors.
* [ ] Copy its recommended changelog entry to the [Draft Changelog](https://github.com/DataBiosphere/toil/wiki/Draft-Changelog).
* [ ] Append the issue number in parentheses to the changelog entry.
